summary.overall_findings: Colgate-Palmolive's public disclosures document mechanisms for automatic tracking and feedback within its AI systems, alongside board education that included topics on artificial intelligence and machine learning. These materials address 6 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, with policy documents outlining a commitment to compliance with laws for AI systems under governance and referencing data privacy measures within AI systems for privacy. Further, policy documents explicitly mention AI use-cases and a commitment to bias mitigation for fairness, and outline accountability mechanisms for AI systems, including for third-party partners, under external accountability. This assessment draws on 13 publicly available sources, and no qualifying public evidence was found for explainability.
